timeline.message: added get Team to check valid team

timeline.bodyText: If we want to use a more friendly message, it makes sense to do this at the DAO so that the message is coherent wherever it is used.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Could be a better approach to create a dedicated validation method that takes in input the id of the team and checks its existence, maybe without fetching the whole team data from the database.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Let us upgrade to Junit 5, make sure the class extends AbstractAutowiredControllerJunit5TestBase
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Might be worth adding a test to the TeamServiceAutowireTest.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Let us extract the expected message to its own variable.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: The limit 1 is not required, this query will always return 1 value.
timeline.author: marcomarasca
marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: As previously noted, if you want to have a consistent message this can be applied to the get in the dao
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: You can return a boolean from your query
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: You can import statically the needed assertion methods.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: The public modifier is not needed
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: We should test the logic of the method and not that a single line of code is invoked.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Good practice is to setup the mock for this call.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: You are making an additional query that is not necessary, the get(teamId) already throws an exception.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Assertions. is not needed as the assertion methods are statically imported.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.message: add tests, add exception to get function
